arm_group.description: The phacoemulsifications tip used was the easyTip 2.2mm tip (Oertli Instruments, Berneck, Switzerland). The cristaline lens was divided into four quadrants using an aspiration flow rate of 10ml/min and vacuum of 70 mmHg. The quadrants were aspirated using the following linear power and fluidic settings: aspiration flow rate 50ml/min, vacuum 600 mmHg, bottle height 100cm.

The phacoemulsifications tip used was an infusion assisted easyTip 2.2mm (Oertli Instruments, Berneck, Switzerland). The cristaline lens was divided into four quadrants using an aspiration flow rate of 10ml/min and vacuum of 70 mmHg. The quadrants were aspirated using the following linear power and fluidic settings: aspiration flow rate 50ml/min, vacuum 600 mmHg, bottle height 100cm.

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study was to compare the intraoperative efficiency, safety and postoperative
      outcomes of cataract surgery with two different "high-fluidic" settings.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Two Phacoemulsification-methods: EasyTip 2.2mm vs. Infusion Assisted EasyTip 2.2mm

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  bilateral age-related cataract

          -  good overall physical constitution

          -  LOCS 2-5

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  previous intraocular surgery or ocular trauma

          -  previous corneal pathology

          -  previous endothelial cell count <1200

          -  glaucoma

          -  uveitis

          -  PEX

          -  diabetic retinopathy and any other severe retinal pathology that would make a
             postoperative visual acuity of 20/40 (decimal equivalent = 0.5) or better unlikely

          -  intraocular complication like posterior capsular

          -  postoperative comlpications (e.g. postoperative uveitis)

facility.name: Department of Ophthalmology and Optometry of the Medical University Vienna

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Two Phacoemulsification-methods: EasyTip 2.2mm vs. Infusion Assisted EasyTip 2.2mm

authority: Austria: Federal Ministry for Health and Women

primary_outcome.description: time spent for the phacoemulsification process was the phacoemulsification tip time (PTT) needed to divide the nucleus and the PTT needed to conquer it
time in seconds required had 100% power been used throughout the phacoemulsification process documented for the separation of the nucleus (divide) and the aspiration of the quadrants (conquer)
amount of BSS used for dividing and conquering

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator)
